unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) is accelerating its smart meter installation program across the state, aiming to replace all conventional meters by December 31, 2025. The initiative, a key component of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), seeks to improve billing efficiency and reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C o. L t d. (M S E D C L) is accelerating its smart meter installation program across the state, aiming to replace all conventional meters by December thirty one, two thousand and twenty five. The initiative, a key component of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), seeks to improve billing efficiency and reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses.

unnormalised: Early data from pilot projects in Pune and Nagpur indicate a significant reduction in power theft, with potential savings estimated at Rs. 500 crore annually. Consumers will benefit from real-time consumption data via a dedicated mobile app, promoting informed energy usage.
normalised: Early data from pilot projects in Pune and Nagpur indicate a significant reduction in power theft, with potential savings estimated at rupee five hundred crore annually. Consumers will benefit from real-time consumption data via a dedicated mobile app, promoting informed energy usage.

unnormalised: "This is a crucial step towards a 'Atmanirbhar' energy sector," stated Mr. Deshmukh, MSEDCL Chairman, during a press conference held at 11:00 hrs today. The project, initiated on 15/08/2022, targets initially urban areas, but will extend to rural regions by early 2024. The meters, compliant with Indian Standards (IS), record usage every 15 minutes and transmit it to MSEDCL's data center. Challenges regarding data privacy and network security are being addressed with robust encryption protocols. The next review meeting is scheduled for 09:00 hrs on November 15, 2023.
normalised: "This is a crucial step towards a 'Atmanirbhar' energy sector," stated Mister Deshmukh, M S E D C L Chairman, during a press conference held at eleven zero zero hours today.
